did.unittitle: Axel Sigurd Burman and Birger Fritiof Burman papers

bioghist.p: Axel Sigurd Burman (1875-196?) was a chemist in Sweden and head of the Swedish Patent Office. His brother, Birger Fritiof Burman (1873-1946), was a metallurgical engineer who emigrated to the United States.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of records of the Burmans' work on a process for the extraction of alumina (aluminum oxide) from aluminum-rich clays. Axel Burman developed the process, and the engineering work was done by Birger Burman in the U.S. Records include patents, design drawings, calculations, an English summary of the process, and correspondence, partly in Swedish.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
